title: Weekly Note - Week 26 2025
summary: Major project development week with breakthrough improvements in Collapsi RL training system, comprehensive academic documentation, and significant progress on the Interactive CV project. Key achievements include fixing game movement rules, integrating MCTS, achieving high RL win rates, and modularizing codebases.
accomplishments: Fixed Collapsi movement rules allowing direction changes
Implemented DFS pathfinding for game mechanics
Integrated Obsidian with Claude Code using MCP server
Created comprehensive guidance documentation for Obsidian-MCP setup
Tested all 12 MCP tools and created template system
Enhanced RL training with session timestamps and architecture preservation
Completed comprehensive academic paper analysis project
Achieved breakthrough RL performance (50.9-54.7% win rates)
Made initial commit for interactive CV project
Integrated Mark S. Ball's tutorial into Collapsi UI
Set up Obsidian-Claude Code integration for team
Transformed academic papers into 300+ line technical documents
insights: DFS pathfinding is perfect for constrained movement on small boards
Mixed opponent pools prevent training plateaus
Monte Carlo returns are better than GAE for short games
Session timestamps prevent checkpoint confusion for RL training
Movement rule flexibility significantly transforms game strategy
Modular architecture is essential for ML systems maintainability
Sometimes stepping back to fix core assumptions (movement rules) unlocks massive improvements downstream
learning: MCTS implementation patterns for two-player games
Importance of verifying game rules before implementation
Benefits of modular design paying off immediately
Value of consistent documentation to prevent knowledge loss
challenges: Initial game rule confusion cost time
Missed daily notes early in week
future_work: Implement AlphaZero training for Collapsi RL
Set up GitHub Pages deployment for Collapsi
Prepare AlphaZero implementation plan for future work
Create more automations for Obsidian Integration
